instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
This arrived with no power and no liquid damage. Board looks pristine. Not sure what to check next.

PM_BATLOW_L 3.3V

SMC_ADAPTER_EN 3.3V

PM_PWRBTN_L 3.4V

PM_RSMRST_L 3.3V

SMC_PM_G2_EN. -  3.43V

RTC_RESET_L. -  3.3V

PPVRTC_G3H  -  3.43V

PCH_SRTCRST_L 3.36V 

ALL_SYS_PWRGD 0V

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Yes 3.4v on 3V3_S5 and SUS

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L, at same time.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Yes, PM_PWRBTN_L has a drop pulse

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Check PM_SLP_S4/3_L for pulse (at same time).

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: yes both  PM_SLP_S4/3_L pulse

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
Check for pulse at all big cois; at same time when trigger SMC_ONOFF_L.
Do the same for ALL_SYS_PWRGD too.

Just in case, try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
back to this board

yes all big coils and ALL_SYSPWRGD has a quick pulse when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Can you catch a pulse at PLT_RESET_L too?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: No pulse at  PLT_RESET_L

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Check for pulse at pins 5, 6 & 3 of U1950.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: pulse at pin 5 but no pulse at pin 6 & 3

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Tie together pins 5 & 6 and test again the board.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Still no power but there is a pulse at pins 6 and 3 now

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
PLT_RESET_L pulsing now?

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: All testing was performed with fan disconnected. When the fan is connected board now consistently powers up but fan spins very fast. Same with or without keyboard connected. only drawing .168 amps

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
If trackpad is not connected, the fan will spin with max speed.
Do you get CPU core voltage now?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
CPU voltages still the same as before.

Without fan plugged in board only draws 0.76 amps but as soon as the fan is plugged in it goes up to 0.170 amps so still not fully booting.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
As I said, fan spins to max, if trackpad is not connected; or has a problem with its temp sensors.
Keyboard is not involved here.

PLT_RESET_L stays high now?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: PLT_RESET_L still 0v

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Check CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and CPU_VR_READY.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD  1.050V

CPU_VR_READY 1.050V

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
Be sure R1962 is good.
Remove R2071/81 and check PLT_RESET_L.
If still low, remove U2071 and test it again.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
R1962 is good

R2071/81 does not exist in boardview or schematic?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: PLT_RESET_L. low with U2071 removed

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: I hope you didn't check for "R2071/81"; there are two resistors, R2071 and R2081!

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: When R2071 is typed into 820-4924 board view no results are found

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
"[SIZE=7][B]820-3476 no power"[/B][/SIZE]
Isn't this your thread title???

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
yes but do not have board view for 820-3476. Thought 4924 is closest board view available for this board.

If you have correct board view can you share?

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
Here it comes...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/19aZ0yIhyjP8nVC0GlRJQj6vHFXyDI9X-/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: PLT_RESET_L still 0v with  R2071/81 removed and U2071

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message:
Then PCH has a problem.
Try heating it, to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: No change after heating PCH with quality flux. To the donar pile it goes

threads.title: 820-3476 no power
threads.message: Just in case, check all voltages from page 11.
